alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 08 at 3:14PM EST until February 10 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THURSDAY TO 7 PM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 9 inches, sleet accumulations up to one quarter of an inch and ice accumulations around one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Northeast Aroostook and Northwest Aroostook Counties. * WHEN...From 7 PM Thursday to 7 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning and evening commutes. Gusty winds developing late afternoon Friday could bring down tree branches on any trees coated in snow and ice.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory means that periods of snow, sleet or freezing rain will cause travel difficulties. Expect slippery roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.
